title: geth in light mode hanging with 100% CPU
body:
#### System information

```
Geth
Version: 1.9.9-stable
Git Commit: 017449971e1e9e220efcd97d3313a0e27f47003b
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [64 63]
Go Version: go1.13.4
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/build/ethereum-XCZsIR/.go
```
OS: Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 LTS
System: AWS ec2 t3.small (2GB RAM, 2 Cores)

#### Expected behaviour

Geth using little CPU and syncing blocks

#### Actual behaviour

Geth using 100% CPU and not syncing blocks, geth being stuck at block `9120454`.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Run geth for 11 days:

```
% ps f -o user,pid,nice,%cpu,%mem,cputime,etime,tty8,command ax
USER     PID  NI %CPU %MEM     TIME     ELAPSED TTY      COMMAND
geth   28935   0  4.1 43.3 10:58:35 10-23:27:34 ?        /usr/bin/geth --cache 512 --syncmode light --rpc --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpcapi eth,net,web3 --maxpeers 60 --verbosity 3 --rpcvhosts=censored
```

#### RPC

`geth attach` is not working, rpc is.
This is a script I run to see block height between different hosts:

```
% check_eth
Host            Peers     Blocks  Delta
---------------------------------------
geth-node          12    9120454  (ref)
parity-node-1      10    9120605   +151
parity-node-2      13    9120605   +151
parity-node-3      13    9120605   +151
```

#### Logs

`journalctl -u geth` [geth.log](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/3973324/geth.log)

#### Cacti

![cacti1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20477825/70996075-520c9a00-20d2-11ea-92cb-f8909973d8b2.png)

My workaround so far (via cronjob every 5 minutes):

```bash
#!/bin/sh

exec geth --exec 'admin.peers' attach \
        | grep -P 'enode|MultiGeth' \
        | grep -B1 -F MultiGeth \
        | grep enode \
        | cut -d '"' -f 2 \
        | while read enode
        do
                geth --exec "admin.removePeer('$enode')" attach
        done
```

```
[{
    caps: ["eth/63", "eth/64", "les/2", "les/3"],
```
Dictionary keys needs to be quoted: 
```
[{
    "caps": ["eth/63", "eth/64", "les/2", "les/3"],
```
It's just a javascript object, not json formatted
